see chapter on mental health) for women at high risk of pre-eclampsia and /or gestational hypertension.
Definitions 
Hypertension 
• A systolic blood pressure ≥ 140 mmHg but <160 mmHg on two occasions, taken at least 4 hours apart, AND/OR
a diastolic blood pressure ≥ 90 mmHg but < 110 mmHg on two occasions, taken at least 4 hours apart.
• A raised systolic pressure is indicative of hypertension even in the absence of a raised diastolic blood pressure.
